verses.verse: To the chief Musician<WH5329> upon Jonathelemrechokim<WH3128>, Michtam<WH4387> of David<WH1732>, when the Philistines<WH6430> took<WH270> him in Gath<WH1661>. Be merciful<WH2603> unto me, O God<WH430>: for man<WH582> would swallow me up<WH7602>; he fighting<WH3898> daily<WH3117> oppresseth<WH3905> me. Michtam: or, A golden Psalm of David
Mine enemies<WH8324> would daily<WH3117> swallow<WH7602> me up: for they be many<WH7227> that fight<WH3898> against me, O thou most High<WH4791>. enemies: Heb. observers
What time<WH3117> I am afraid<WH3372>, I will trust<WH982> in thee.
In God<WH430> I will praise<WH1984> his word<WH1697>, in God<WH430> I have put my trust<WH982>; I will not fear<WH3372> what flesh<WH1320> can do<WH6213> unto me.
Every day<WH3117> they wrest<WH6087> my words<WH1697>: all their thoughts<WH4284> are against me for evil<WH7451>.
They gather themselves together<WH1481>, they hide<WH6845> <WH6845> themselves, they mark<WH8104> my steps<WH6119>, when they wait<WH6960> for my soul<WH5315>.
Shall they escape<WH6405> by iniquity<WH205>? in thine anger<WH639> cast down<WH3381> the people<WH5971>, O God<WH430>.
Thou tellest<WH5608> my wanderings<WH5112>: put<WH7760> thou my tears<WH1832> into thy bottle<WH4997>: are they not in thy book<WH5612>?
When<WH3117> I cry<WH7121> unto thee, then shall mine enemies<WH341> turn<WH7725> back<WH268>: this I know<WH3045>; for God<WH430> is for me.
In God<WH430> will I praise<WH1984> his word<WH1697>: in the LORD<WH3068> will I praise<WH1984> his word<WH1697>.
In God<WH430> have I put my trust<WH982>: I will not be afraid<WH3372> what man<WH120> can do<WH6213> unto me.
Thy vows<WH5088> are upon me, O God<WH430>: I will render<WH7999> praises<WH8426> unto thee.

For thou hast delivered<WH5337> my soul<WH5315> from death<WH4194>: wilt not thou deliver my feet<WH7272> from falling<WH1762>, that I may walk<WH1980> before<WH6440> God<WH430> in the light<WH216> of the living<WH2416>?
